grf.name: Timberwolf's UK Trains 1.4.2
grf.description: A maximalist UK train set including vehicles from 1800-2020. Features 2cc colours, long vehicle scale, 2x zoom and extra rotation sprites.

parameters.name: Purchase cost modifier
parameters.desc: Increase or decrease build costs to change difficulty, or balance with other GRF sets.{}{}{RED}Higher values may be difficult, especially in the early game.{BLACK}

parameters.name: Running cost modifier
parameters.desc: Increase or decrease running costs to change difficulty, or balance with other GRF sets.{}{}{RED}Higher values may be difficult, especially in the early game.{BLACK}

parameters.name: Maximum multiple unit length
parameters.desc: Some multiple units included in this set have very long consists in prototypical usage (e.g. Eurostar).{}{}Alter this parameter to set the maximum length in tiles for these longer units.

parameters.name: Running cost penalty for old trains
parameters.desc: When trains reach the end of their working life they will become more expensive to run.{}{}Higher settings cause this this to happen faster and the increase in costs to be larger.{}{}For casual network games and other situations where players may not be able to replace expired vehicles for several decades, {ORANGE}Mild{BLACK} is recommended as it will still allow most well-designed networks to break even or return a small profit.

parameters.name: Station rating algorithm
parameters.desc: Allows using a replacement station rating algorithm which is better tuned for this set.{}{}The speed of vehicle required to get a full rating increases over time, starting at {SILVER}30km/h{BLACK} in {GREEN}1830{BLACK} and rising to {SILVER}200km/h{BLACK} by {GREEN}2000{BLACK} for passenger trains. For cargo this is {SILVER}20km/h{BLACK} to {SILVER}112km/h{BLACK}.{}{}Prior to {GREEN}1900{BLACK}, allowed time between pickups and allowable waiting cargo are more lenient, especially before {GREEN}1850{BLACK}. From {GREEN}1970{BLACK} excessive waiting cargo at a station will be penalised more strongly than in the base game. This effect increases after {GREEN}2010{BLACK}.

parameters.name: Penalty for boring networks (experimental)
parameters.desc: Applies a penalty to ship and air cargo routes with no other transport connections when using improved station ratings.{}{}The {ORANGE}Draconian{BLACK} or {ORANGE}Evil{BLACK} settings may result in stations becoming impossible to serve unless ships and aircraft are removed from the route.{}{}See readme for more details and supported industry sets.

fixed_strings.str_mu_cannot_attach: Multiple units can only be coupled to another multiple unit of the same (or compatible) type.
fixed_strings.str_needs_second_power_car: This consist needs a second power car of the same type. Buy one from the purchase menu and attach it to the end of the train.
fixed_strings.str_unsupported_incomplete: Incomplete economies in sets such as AXIS may produce unexpected results when penalties for boring networks are enabled.
